Noods is here with a "life in retail" update :ptv-snicker:
Hi Noodle
Hello, fellow hat <3
How was your day?
*looks at clock*
How much time you got? lol
I got enough
Biggest complaint first
New company is using different software for certification, and they want everyone certified under it.  Doesn't matter when you got your old one.
At best, you got a week's notice that you need to have it done by tomorrow to be eligible to continue working
So I'm gonna be spending an extra three hours or more tonight / tomorrow morning to be recertified for tobacco / alcohol sales.  And I got alcohol certified only a few months ago
And I'm gonna stop there or else I might end up pissing my self off into handing my two weeks in tomorrow xD
Sorry to hear that but I hope things get better soon
S'okay, I might call off saturday, turn my 4 day weekend into a 5 day @w@
Have they at least hired more people?
yes, but I keep thinking, "Hire one or two more part timers.  If we get into that situation again, do NOT count on me to pull extra days consistently."
At least they‚Äôre trying but they never should have let it get to that point
That's what happens when you have 2 full timers leave in a span of 2 weeks
And then have part timers already soaking up all the hours they want get more pushed onto them
Doesn't help that corporate more or less has the store running at minimum capacity, so we don't have room to go lower :/
Legit, when I first started, 2nd shift had 3 people on it, the odd day or two we might have 2, but we had some wiggle room
Now it's 2. Period.  And one of them will be left alone for 1.5 - 2 hours before night shift comes in to take over.
That‚Äôs the main problem with retail, corporate doesn‚Äôt understand how to run things
What's crazier is that they wanted us to cut the store hours even further
Even though we're at this point with what we're using.
Anyone want to place bets on how long before my complaints become "I gave them my 2 weeks."? c:
2 months
Let's see :P
Hopefully you can last as long as you need to work there
If anything, this place will kill my procrastination tendencies
"Encourage" me to find a programming job
Likely after I put in my 2 weeks xD
That‚Äôs a good way to look at it
Because, imo, $9.50 an hour is not worth the stress / frustration it causes
That‚Äôs better than what my sister makes at the local movie theater
What's she make?
Because, even with that wage, we have a hard time hiring / keeping people.  I'm one of the few young employees whose lasted as long as I have
Something around $8 but I don‚Äôt know the exact amount
We even recently had a new hire who decided not to accept the position.  Quit before the training period was up.
How is your other job going?
Is going.  A lot slower than I'd like, but I like my boss and it's a startup, so what can you do? xD
Got work coming this sunday (another reason considering calling off on saturday)
